details.title: Correlated Clutter and Resultant Properties of Binary Signals
details.abstract: A simple Markov process model of binary, digitized radar clutter returns is assumed. Probability distributions for the number of hits in n observations are developed for small n with a binary parameter describing the process derived for Rayleigh distributed clutter. Tables of distributions are included, along with an example to show the effects of correlation on the false-alarm probabilities of a sliding-window detector.
details.journal_title: IEEE Transactions on Aerospace and Electronic Systems
